intro: Tamonea ibaguensis, commonly known as the Ibaguense Tamonea, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
